it.unibz.krdb.obda.owlrefplatform.owlapi3

Class QuestOWLFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unibz.krdb.obda.owlrefplatform.owlapi3.QuestOWLFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.semanticweb.owlapi.reasoner.OWLReasonerFactory

    public class QuestOWLFactory
extends Object
implements org.semanticweb.owlapi.reasoner.OWLReasonerFactory
    Implementation of an OWLReasonerFactory that can create instances of Quest. Note, to create an instance of Quest first you must call the method setPreferenceHolder(Properties) with your parameters see Quest.java for a description of the preferences. Also, if you use Quest in Virtual ABox mode you must set an OBDAModel with your mappings.
    Author:
    Mariano Rodriguez Muro
    See Also:
    OBDAModel

    • Method Detail

      • setOBDAController

        public void setOBDAController(OBDAModel apic)
        Sets the mappings that will be used to create instances of Quest. If this is not set, mappings will be null and Quest will be started in "classic ABox" mode. If the mappings are not null, then the mode must be "Virtual ABox" model.
        Parameters:
        apic -

      • setImplicitDBConstraints

        public void setImplicitDBConstraints(ImplicitDBConstraintsReader userConstraints)
        Sets the user-supplied database constraints, i.e. Foreign and primary keys that are not in the database
        Parameters:
        userConstraints -
